10

Yahoo CEO Thompson out; Levinsohn interim leader

After criticism over an exaggeration on his resume about his education, CEO Scott Thompson was replaced by Ross Levinsohn, Yahoo's head of global media. (AP)
  • Interactive Yahoo's struggles continue
  • Biographies Scott Thompson | Ross Levinsohn

Report: JPMorgan executive to resign

JPMorgan Chase is expected to accept the resignation of its chief investment officer, Ina Drew, after the bank lost $2 billion in a trading blunder. (AP)
  • 5/10 JPMorgan acknowledges $2 billion trading loss

BU student recovering after crash

Meg Theriault, 21, suffered from injuries in the New Zealand accident that killed three students and injured four others from Boston University. (AP)

Mother's Day

Lilac Sunday at the Arnold Arboretum

Mothers, daughters, and sons gathered in Jamaica Plain's Arnold Arboretum for the 104th Lilac Sunday, a Mother's Day tradition.
  • pictures Why I love mom | submit Photos of mom, me
  • video Boston kids on why they love their mothers

Boy, 4, drowns in Westborough pool

A 4-year-old boy drowned Sunday in a Westborough apartment complex's murky swimming pool that had not yet opened for the summer, authorities said. (Globe)

Legendary bass player 'Duck' Dunn dies

Donald "Duck" Dunn, the bassist who helped create the gritty Memphis soul sound as part of the group Booker T. and the MGs, died Sunday at 70. (AP)
